content.text: Strategic planning is the process of defining the school's direction and making decisions on allocating resources to pursue this direction. Eduversal schools operate on a 3-5 year strategic cycle.

steps.title: Analysis
steps.desc: SWOT analysis, stakeholder surveys, data review.

steps.title: Formulation
steps.desc: Setting vision, mission, and strategic goals.

steps.title: Implementation
steps.desc: Annual School Improvement Plans (SIP) and action plans.

content.text: The SIP is the annual operational document that translates strategic goals into actionable steps.

content.title: SIP Components
rows: Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound (SMART) objective.
How we know the goal is met.

content.text: KPIs are used to measure the health and performance of the school.

content.title: Standard Network KPIs
items: Academic: EASE scores, Cambridge exam results, University placement rates.
Operational: Student enrollment, Staff retention, Budget adherence.
Stakeholder: Parent satisfaction (NPS), Student wellbeing surveys.
